remarks: Given a theorem, there is an explicitly definable witnessing provable pre-statement for the provability of the theorem.  (However, this pre-statement requires infinitely many DV conditions, which is sometimes inconvenient.)  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Jul-2016.)

mthmpps.m $e |- M = ( C u. ( D \ ( Z X. Z ) ) ) $.
